page.title: 02Family shopping
page.content: Most people in Pinvin shop weekly at Gateway in Pershore, about a mile away. The least popular supermarket in the area seems to be the Pershore Co-op. Apart from the small, and therefore expensive,{village stores}in Peopleton and Pinvin there are no other places to shop for food. It is therefore essential to have a car as bus services are either very infrequent or non-existent. Old people have to either take a taxi into Pershore, a train into Worcester or put up with the limited range and high prices of the village store. Some people prefer to shop monthly and usually go to one of the big {supermarkets}in Worcester with lots of variety, and lower prices.
